property.name: merge.after.fetch
property.description: If true, then segments of crawl are merged after fetch is complete.

property.name: index.sns
property.description: If true, then the Index-Sns Plugin are index with sns dates. Otherwise, without sns dates.

property.name: plugin.folders
property.description: Directories where nutch plugins are located. Each element may be a relative or absolute path. If absolute, it is used as is. If relative, it is searched for on the classpath.

property.name: plugin.includes
property.description: Regular expression naming plugin directory names to include. Any plugin not matching this expression is excluded. In any case you need at least include the nutch-extensionpoints plugin. By default Nutch includes crawling just HTML and plain text via HTTP, and basic indexing and search plugins. In order to use HTTPS please enable protocol-httpclient, but be aware of possible intermittent problems with the underlying commons-httpclient library.

property.name: plugin.excludes
property.description: Regular expression naming plugin directory names to exclude.

property.name: crawl-prepare.order
property.description: space delimited list of IPreCrawl Implementations to execute these classes in order

property.name: url.type
property.description: catalog or web

property.name: http.agent.name
property.description:
HTTP 'User-Agent' request header. MUST NOT be empty - please set this to a single word uniquely related to your organization.
NOTE: You should also check other related properties:
http.robots.agents http.agent.description http.agent.url http.agent.email http.agent.version
and set their values appropriately.

property.name: http.agent.description
property.description: Further description of our bot- this text is used in the User-Agent header. It appears in parenthesis after the agent name.

property.name: http.agent.url
property.description: A URL to advertise in the User-Agent header. This will appear in parenthesis after the agent name. Custom dictates that this should be a URL of a page explaining the purpose and behavior of this crawler.

property.name: http.agent.email
property.description: An email address to advertise in the HTTP 'From' request header and User-Agent header. A good practice is to mangle this address (e.g. 'info at example dot com') to avoid spamming.

property.name: http.agent.version
property.description: A version string to advertise in the User-Agent header.

property.name: db.fetch.schedule.class
property.description: The implementation of fetch schedule. DefaultFetchSchedule simply adds the original fetchInterval to the last fetch time, regardless of page changes.

property.name: mail.enabled
property.description: If true, sending mail report for each segment is enabled. Otherwise disabled.

property.name: mail.sender.address
property.description: The email-address of the sender of system mails.

property.name: mail.sender.personal
property.description: The personal name of the sender of system mails.

property.name: mail.receiver.address
property.description: The email-address of the default receiver of system mails.

property.name: mail.receiver.personal
property.description: The personal name of the default receiver of system mails.

property.name: mail.host
property.description: The host of the email server.

property.name: mail.port
property.description: The port of the connection with the email server.

property.name: mail.user
property.description: The username for the authentication with the email server.

property.name: mail.password
property.description: The password for the authentication with the email server.

property.name: mail.auth
property.description: If true, authentification with email server is enabled. Otherwise disabled.

property.name: mail.starttls
property.description: If true, starting TLS is enabled. Otherwise disabled.

property.name: report.codes
property.description: Comma seperated http codes, that will be included into the url report mail. You can also define ranges by seperating two codes with a hyphen.
